_header: In a garden underneath a tree
_description: A chanson d’aventure of the unhappy lover — six 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas and a 2-line refrain: ‘This nyghtes rest’.

BodAsh176.First Lines:
In a garden vnderneth a tree together the floures that grewe
                    therbyewalking alone I dyd espyea man in paynes that was
                    prest…
BodAsh176.Last Lines:
…I can no more but ever one adewe farewell this nyghtes
                    rest
BodAsh176.Editions:
Sandison,  Helen Estabrook. 
             The ‘Chanson d’Aventure’ in Middle English.
Bryn Mawr College Monographs,  Monograph Series 12. Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1913: 100-1.
Wagner,  B. M. 
             “New Songs of the Reign of Henry VIII.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         50 (1935): 452-55: 455.
